p: In patients with SARS-CoV-2 infection, the most important features that suggest myocardial injury are electrocardiogram changes and troponin elevation coupled with echocardiography showing signs of subclinical left ventricular diastolic impairment or even reduced ejection fraction (EF) in severe cases [ 11], with a higher likelihood of the need for mechanical ventilation in those with reduced EF, as was seen during previous coronavirus outbreaks [ 9].
